message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SI, cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with polar codes, which are a type of error-correcting codes used in information theory. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses optimization problems and algorithms for efficient decoding, which are relevant to cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.CC (Computational Complexity). The use of mutual information as a performance constraint suggests cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) as another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a method for balancing complexity and performance, which could be relevant to cs.LG (Machine Learning).
